name: IdleTree
description:
_______________________________________________________________________________________
Become a tree in this small idle game and collect water to grow as big as you can.
Use the resources available to upgrade yourself to get even more resources. 
_______________________________________________________________________________________

####Important game information####
First screen will say the goal is to achieve level 50 as fast as possible. Don't expect to do this in a few hours, even with autoclicking-cheat it took my friend approx 2 hours to get to level 50 and it clicked like 15 times per second. The game is designed to take a long time to finish and for a normal player to play maybe 10 minutes per session.

As any idle game IdleTree also contain something called "Ascension". 
Ascension is where you spend your hard-earned DNA points to get permanent upgrades that will make mechanics in the game stronger. These will never reset when accepting the terms of ascension. 

Each Ascension will ...
... Reset the following:
# Player level
# Water
# Upgrades that require water

... NOT reset the following:
# Unspent DNA points.
# Upgrades that require DNA
# Level records
# Objective progression

You will unlock the ability to ascend at level 10!
_______________________________________________________________________________________

XP formula:
Seed stages: 25 x Level
Tree stages: 200 x Level x Level x Level
Fret not! With all available upgrades it will go quite fast even with the amount of XP needed per level. (First run to level 10 is always the slowest, so be patient and try to get there at least once!) 
_______________________________________________________________________________________
Assets I've used in this project:
https://arks.itch.io/dino-characters
https://mamanezakon.itch.io/forest-tileset - I used the tree you find here as a guide to paint more versions of the tree as well. I did use the tree in this tileset as well.

Everything not found in these two links I have created myself with either the Godot engine or the software Aseprite.
